summary:
Dutch is a West Germanic language spoken by around 30 million people worldwide. It is the main language of the Netherlands and Flanders (Belgium). Dutch was also spoken in South Africa until it was replaced by Afrikaans, a language that evolved from Dutch.

Dutch is one of the official languages in Suriname and some Caribbean islands. It was used in Indonesia during colonial times and still influences the Indonesian language. Many words in Dutch are similar to English and German, but it has its unique features, like grammatical genders and modal particles.
title: Dutch language
